title.general: You are in the Title section. Enter a human-readable name for this resource. It should be written in plain language, include sufficient detail to facilitate search and discovery, and be no more than 4,000 characters long.
title.edit:
Avoid using the same title as a related paper if it doesnâ€™t sufficiently describe the data as a standalone object.

keywords.general: You are in Keywords section. Enter relevant keywords separated by a comma.
keywords.add:
Keywords field (required), enter terms that could help both technical and non-technical users to discover this resource, up to a maximum of 4,000 characters.

references.general:
You are in References section. With this question, you are telling us the references or citations related to this resource. Your publication may present multiple types of products--for example, data plus software to analyze it--but, it is helpful for us to know what you consider is the most important product. And don't worry: you can change this later.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
references.add:
Any papers or software that use this data should be referenced. You can either enter the DOI which will generate the reference's citation OR manually enter the information.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
